Findings.Title: Unencrypted EBS volume
Findings.Description: EBS volume vol-0fa1327b5cc8cd621 is not configured with encryption using KMS

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the EC2 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/v2/home?region=us-east-2#VolumeDetails:volumeId=vol-0fa1327b5cc8cd621)
2. Click the Actions button on the top and Create Snapshot
3. In the left navigation pane click on Snapshots and select the new created snapshot
4. Click the Actions button on the top and Create Volume
5. Fill the parameters and check the Encrypt this volume checkbox
6. Click the Create Volume button
7. Before replacing the volume, verify that all identities used to launch the instance has decrypt permissions on the selected encryption key
8. Stop the EC2 instance
9. Under Volumes select the current unencrypted volume and click Actions on top and then Detach Volume
10. Select the new encrypted volume and click Actions on top and than Attach Volume
11. Select the instance and click Attach Volume

Findings.Title: IAM user MFA is not enabled
Findings.Description: Multi-factor authentication is not enabled for the user dev-ganesh-admin with console access

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the IAM console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/iam/home?#/users/dev-ganesh-admin?section=security_credentials)
2. Under Assigned MFA device click Manage
3. Complete the Manage MFA device wizard

Findings.Title: EC2 instance metadata service supports insecure version
Findings.Description: EC2 instance i-01892acac5e6e4824 (Nexpose-trial-7Sept) is not enforcing Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)

Console.Steps:
1. Ermetic's recommendation to transition to IMDSv2 is based on 1 month of usage. If the resource was created more recently than that, you'll need to wait, or verify that IMDSv1 wasn't used in that time period
2. CloudWatch metric MetadataNoToken (https://console.aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/home?region=us-east-2#metricsV2:graph=~(metrics~(~(~'AWS*2fEC2~'MetadataNoToken~'InstanceId~'i-01892acac5e6e4824))~view~'timeSeries~stacked~false~region~'us-east-2~start~'-PT720H~end~'P0D~stat~'Average~period~300);query=~'*7bAWS*2fEC2*2cInstanceId*7d*20metadata) shows no usage of IMDSv1 and therefore the i-01892acac5e6e4824 (Nexpose-trial-7Sept) is ready to be fully transitioned to use IMDSv2
3. Run the following command: aws ec2 modify-instance-metadata-options --instance-id arn:aws:ec2:us-east-2:034025401910:instance/i-01892acac5e6e4824 --http-token required --http-endpoint enabled --region us-east-2

Findings.Description: User dev-ganesh-admin was recently granted admin privileges

Findings.Title: S3 bucket MFA delete is not enabled
Findings.Description: Bucket runbook-s3-data-dump-qa MFA delete is not enabled

Console.Steps:
1. Run the following command with the root user using AWS CLI:
aws s3api put-bucket-versioning --bucket runbook-s3-data-dump-qa --versioning-configuration Status=Enabled,MFADelete=Enabled --mfa "SERIAL 123456"

Findings.Title: Overprivileged IAM role
Findings.Description: Role automation-role, linked to 2 workloads, has 2 policies attached granting it permissions on 8 services but is only using 3 services

Console.Steps:
1. Create a new managed policy Role_automation-role_Policy and attach it to role automation-role
2. Remove all existing policies of Role automation-role
        1. Detach managed policy AmazonEC2RoleforSSM
        2. Detach managed policy AmazonSSMManagedInstanceCore

Findings.Title: Public EC2 instance
Findings.Description: 27 EC2 instances accessible directly from a wide range of public IP addresses

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the EC2 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/)
2. In the left navigation panel, under Security section, select Security Groups
3. For each public security group, click on the security group id
4. In the Inbound rules tab, press Edit inbound rules button
5. For each public inbound rule: Edit the rule to limit access to specific IP addresses or click Delete at the far right of the row
6. Click Save rules to confirm

Tags.Key: Do not terminate or stop this server
Tags.Value: Do not terminate or stop without asking owner
Seeker Account setup on this server
Coverity Account setup on this server
This ports are open. Since it is the prerequisites of  Fortify SSC
Do not stop this instance without contacting owner

Findings.Title: KMS key automatic key rotation is not enabled
Findings.Description: 15 keys automatic rotation is not enabled

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the KMS console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/kms/)
2. In the left navigation panel, select Customer managed keys
3. In the keys name list, press on the name of the target key
4. Select the Key rotation tab
5. Check the Automatically rotate this CMK every year checkbox
6. Press Save at the far right of the row to confirm

Findings.Title: Password reuse policy does not meet minimum requirements
Findings.Description: Password policy should prevent passwords reuse

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the IAM console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/iam/)
2. In the left navigation pane, choose Account Settings
3. Click Set password policy
4. Set the prevent password reuse policy for at least 24
5. Click Save Changes to confirm

Findings.Title: ECR critical repository vulnerabilities
Findings.Description: 4 repositories with 45 critical vulnerabilities

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the ECR console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ecr/)
2. For each critical vulnerability, follow the CVE link and update the container image to eliminate the risk

Findings.Title: VPC Flow Logs is not set
Findings.Description: 9 VPCs Flow Logs on rejected traffic are not enabled

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the VPC console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/vpc/)
2. In the left navigation panel, under Security section, select Security Groups
3. Click on the target default security group ID
4. Before deleting any rules, verify that the default security group is not used
5. In the Inbound rules tab, press Edit inbound rules button
6. For each inbound rules, click Delete at the far right of the row
7. Click Save rules to confirm
8. In the Outbound rules tab, click Edit outbound rules button
9. For each outbound rules, click Delete at the far right of the row
10. Click Save rules to confirm

Findings.Title: Default security group rules exist
Findings.Description: 15 security groups allow traffic

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the VPC console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/vpc/)
2. In the left navigation panel, under Security section, select Security Groups
3. Click on the target default security group ID
4. Before deleting any rules, verify that the default security group is not used
5. In the Inbound rules tab, press Edit inbound rules button
6. For each inbound rules, click Delete at the far right of the row
7. Click Save rules to confirm
8. In the Outbound rules tab, click Edit outbound rules button
9. For each outbound rules, click Delete at the far right of the row
10. Click Save rules to confirm

Findings.Title: Load balancer insecure communication
Findings.Description: application load balancer qa-alb-pbe allows insecure communication protocols such as HTTP, SSLv3, TLS 1.0 and 1.1

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the EC2 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/v2/home?region=us-west-2#LoadBalancers:search=qa-alb-pbe)
2. On the selected load balancer settings, select the Listeners tab
3. For each listener that does not use secured protocol, select it and click on Edit
4. From the Protocol drop-down list, select the new secured protocol (for example, HTTPS)
5. In the Secure listener settings, select the Security Policy that enforces TLS v1.2 and above
6. Click on Save Changes

Findings.Title: Unencrypted SQS queue
Findings.Description: qa-tools-scheduler-config-collector is not configured with encryption using KMS

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the SQS console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/sqs/home?region=us-west-2#/queues/https%3a%2f%2fsqs.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2f034025401910%2fqa-sqs-tool-scheduler-config-collector/edit)
2. Before changing the encryption, verify that applications using the queue have decrypt permissions
3. In the Encryption section, set the Server-side encryption option to Enabled
4. For the Encryption key type, select AWS Key Management Service key (SSE-KMS)
5. For the Customer master key, select the relevant KMS key. By default, the managed SQS key is used
6. Click Save

1. Sign in to the SQS console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/sqs/home?region=us-west-2#/queues/https%3a%2f%2fsqs.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2f034025401910%2fqa-report-complete-notification-queue/edit)
2. Before changing the encryption, verify that applications using the queue have decrypt permissions
3. In the Encryption section, set the Server-side encryption option to Enabled
4. For the Encryption key type, select AWS Key Management Service key (SSE-KMS)
5. For the Customer master key, select the relevant KMS key. By default, the managed SQS key is used
6. Click Save

Findings.Title: Secrets Manager secret automatic rotation is not enabled
Findings.Description: Secret /secret/background-jobs automatic rotation is not enabled

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the Secrets Manager console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/home?region=us-west-2#!/secret?name=/secret/background-jobs)
2. Scroll down to the Rotation configuration section and click on Edit rotation
3. Enable the Automatic rotation toggle, enter rotation interval and rotation lambda function and click Save.
For more information about automatic secret rotation, go to the AWS documentation (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/latest/userguide/rotate-secrets_turn-on-for-other.html)

Findings.Title: Public S3 bucket
Findings.Description: Bucket qa.us-west-2.armorcode.ai is publicly accessible via bucket policy or Access Control List (ACL)

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the S3 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/s3/bucket/qa.us-west-2.armorcode.ai/property/bpa/edit?region=us-west-2)
2. Since the bucket has public access, block public access might break identities access to the bucket. Verify that only identities from the same account access the bucket before applying the change
3. Check Block all public access and click Save to confirm

Findings.Title: Unencrypted RDS snapshot
Findings.Description: RDS snapshot march is not configured with KMS encryption

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the RDS console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/rds/home?region=us-east-2#db-snapshot:id=march)
2. Before encrypting the RDS snapshot, verify that identities using it are granted permissions to use the KMS key that will be used for encryption
3. Click the Actions button on the top and Copy snapshot
4. Check the Enable encryption checkbox and choose a KMS Key
5. Click Copy snapshot
6. Select the current unencrypted snapshot and click Actions on top and then Delete

Findings.Title: Public Load balancer
Findings.Description: Classic Load Balancer ae6a3c48da7444a26bc3a85585eb10e0 is accessible directly from a wide range of public IP addresses

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the Security Groups console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/vpc/home?region=us-west-1#SecurityGroups:)
2. For each of the 1 security group, under the Inbound rules tab, review the existing rules and click on the Edit inbound rules button
3. Delete or edit each rule's type, port, and source range to restrict it only to the required IP addresses and ports
4. Click Save rules

Findings.Title: Public Lambda function
Findings.Description: Lambda function TestGitGuardian is publicly accessible via API gateway

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the Lambda console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/lambda/home?region=us-west-2#/functions/TestGitGuardian?tab=code)
2. Disabling public access might break identities using the lambda. Before changing the policy, verify that identities using the lambda can access it without public access
3. Click on Permissions inside the Configuration tab
4. Under Resource-based policy statements for each public statement click on Edit and change it to allow access by specific identities

Findings.Title: Unencrypted EBS volume
Findings.Description: EBS volume vol-0de8147d312c6a0d8 is not configured with encryption using KMS

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the EC2 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/v2/home?region=us-east-2#VolumeDetails:volumeId=vol-0de8147d312c6a0d8)
2. Click the Actions button on the top and Create Snapshot
3. In the left navigation pane click on Snapshots and select the new created snapshot
4. Click the Actions button on the top and Create Volume
5. Fill the parameters and check the Encrypt this volume checkbox
6. Click the Create Volume button
7. Before replacing the volume, verify that all identities used to launch the instance has decrypt permissions on the selected encryption key
8. Stop the EC2 instance
9. Under Volumes select the current unencrypted volume and click Actions on top and then Detach Volume
10. Select the new encrypted volume and click Actions on top and than Attach Volume
11. Select the instance and click Attach Volume

Findings.Title: Unencrypted EBS volume
Findings.Description: Launch template grafana_lt was used to launch 1 EC2 instance with 1 EBS volume

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the EC2 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/v2/home?region=us-west-2#LaunchTemplateDetails:launchTemplateId=lt-0bfe615431ffab71e)
2. Click on Actions and Modify template (Create new version)
3. For each unencrypted device under Storage, switch the Encrypted dropdown to Yes.
4. Click Create template version
5. Before replacing the template version, verify that all identities used to launch the instances have decrypt permissions on the selected encryption keys
6. Update auto scaling groups and applications to use the new secured launch template
7. Click on Delete template version to delete the unsecured version
8. Wait until all unencrypted instances are relaunched with the encrypted launch template version

Findings.Title: Unencrypted EBS snapshot
Findings.Description: EBS Snapshot snap-0d87f3cfbd75b48a4 is not configured with encryption using KMS

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the EC2 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/v2/home?region=us-west-2#SnapshotDetails:snapshotId=snap-0d87f3cfbd75b48a4)
2. Before encrypting the EBS snapshot, verify that identities using it are granted permissions to use the KMS key that will be used for encryption
3. Click the Actions button on the top and Copy snapshot

Findings.Title: Unencrypted EBS snapshot
Findings.Description: Launch template grafana_lt was used to launch 1 EC2 instance with 1 EBS volume with 1 EBS snapshot

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the EC2 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/v2/home?region=us-west-2#LaunchTemplateDetails:launchTemplateId=lt-0bfe615431ffab71e)
2. Click on Actions and Modify template (Create new version)
3. For each unencrypted device under Storage, switch the Encrypted dropdown to Yes.
4. Click Create template version
5. Before replacing the template version, verify that all identities used to launch the instances have decrypt permissions on the selected encryption keys
6. Update auto scaling groups and applications to use the new secured launch template
7. Click on Delete template version to delete the unsecured version
8. Wait until all unencrypted instances are relaunched with the encrypted launch template version
9. For each unencrypted snapshot, select it and click Actions on top and then Delete

Findings.Title: EC2 instance metadata service supports insecure version
Findings.Description: EC2 instance i-02363c617c9588cd5 (ArmorCode Test Agent Server New) is not enforcing Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)

Console.Steps:
1. Ermetic's recommendation to transition to IMDSv2 is based on 1 month of usage. If the resource was created more recently than that, you'll need to wait, or verify that IMDSv1 wasn't used in that time period
2. CloudWatch metric MetadataNoToken (https://console.aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/home?region=us-west-2#metricsV2:graph=~(metrics~(~(~'AWS*2fEC2~'MetadataNoToken~'InstanceId~'i-02363c617c9588cd5))~view~'timeSeries~stacked~false~region~'us-west-2~start~'-PT720H~end~'P0D~stat~'Average~period~300);query=~'*7bAWS*2fEC2*2cInstanceId*7d*20metadata) shows no usage of IMDSv1 and therefore the i-02363c617c9588cd5 (ArmorCode Test Agent Server New) is ready to be fully transitioned to use IMDSv2
3. Run the following command: aws ec2 modify-instance-metadata-options --instance-id arn:aws:ec2:us-west-2:034025401910:instance/i-02363c617c9588cd5 --http-token required --http-endpoint enabled --region us-west-2

1. Ermetic's recommendation to transition to IMDSv2 is based on 1 month of usage. If the resource was created more recently than that, you'll need to wait, or verify that IMDSv1 wasn't used in that time period
2. CloudWatch metric MetadataNoToken (https://console.aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/home?region=us-east-2#metricsV2:graph=~(metrics~(~(~'AWS*2fEC2~'MetadataNoToken~'InstanceId~'i-0db5ca6ac7ff27e28))~view~'timeSeries~stacked~false~region~'us-east-2~start~'-PT720H~end~'P0D~stat~'Average~period~300);query=~'*7bAWS*2fEC2*2cInstanceId*7d*20metadata) shows no usage of IMDSv1 and therefore the i-0db5ca6ac7ff27e28 (bastion_host_automation_for_ssm) is ready to be fully transitioned to use IMDSv2
3. Run the following command: aws ec2 modify-instance-metadata-options --instance-id arn:aws:ec2:us-east-2:034025401910:instance/i-0db5ca6ac7ff27e28 --http-token required --http-endpoint enabled --region us-east-2

Findings.Title: EC2 instance metadata service supports insecure version
Findings.Description: EC2 instance i-09c2116514bc9f867 (Partner Jenkins) is not enforcing Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)

Console.Steps:
1. Update the SDKs, CLIs, and any software on the [AwsEc2InstanceModel/arn:aws:ec2:us-west-2:034025401910:instance/i-09c2116514bc9f867] to the latest versions compatible with IMDSv2 in order to use v2 only

The CloudWatch metric shows that IMDSv1 was last used on 08 Sep 2023. Findings.Title: EC2 instance metadata service supports insecure version
Findings.Description: Launch template qa-prometheus-lt is not enforcing Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)

Console.Steps:
1. Ermetic's recommendation to transition to IMDSv2 is based on 1 month of usage. If the resource was created more recently than that, you'll need to wait, or verify that IMDSv1 wasn't used in that time period
2. CloudWatch metric MetadataNoToken (https://console.aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/home?region=us-west-2#metricsV2:graph=~(metrics~(~(~'AWS*2fEC2~'MetadataNoToken~'InstanceId~'i-0576c66f9a0c1b5bb)~(~'...~'i-099b72652f400a861))~view~'timeSeries~stacked~false~region~'us-west-2~start~'-PT720H~end~'P0D~stat~'Average~period~300);query=~'*7bAWS*2fEC2*2cInstanceId*7d*20metadata) shows no usage of IMDSv1 and therefore the qa-prometheus-lt is ready to be fully transitioned to use IMDSv2
3. Sign in to the EC2 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/v2/home?region=us-west-2#LaunchTemplateDetails:launchTemplateId=lt-0e486513906b9e2ac)
4. Select the launch template qa-prometheus-lt and choose Actions, Modify template (Create new version)
5. Expand the Advanced Details section
6. Under Metadata accessible, select Enabled
7. Under Metadata version, select V2 only (token required)
8. Click on the Create template version button
9. Set the new version as the default by clicking on Actions, Set default version
10. Make sure the 1 launch configuration are using the latest version
11. Make sure the 2 EC2 instances are using the latest version
12. Wait until all instances are relaunched with the updated metadata version

Findings.Title: EC2 instance metadata service supports insecure version
Findings.Description: Launch template bhumitatest is not enforcing Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)

Console.Steps:
1. Ermetic's recommendation to transition to IMDSv2 is based on 1 month of usage. If the resource was created more recently than that, you'll need to wait, or verify that IMDSv1 wasn't used in that time period
2. CloudWatch metric MetadataNoToken (https://console.aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/home?region=us-east-1#metricsV2:graph=~(metrics~(~(~'AWS*2fEC2~'MetadataNoToken~'InstanceId~'i-0b9e45a6d033a0a98))~view~'timeSeries~stacked~false~region~'us-east-1~start~'-PT720H~end~'P0D~stat~'Average~period~300);query=~'*7bAWS*2fEC2*2cInstanceId*7d*20metadata) shows no usage of IMDSv1 and therefore the bhumitatest is ready to be fully transitioned to use IMDSv2
3. Sign in to the EC2 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/v2/home?region=us-east-1#LaunchTemplateDetails:launchTemplateId=lt-08b6e2e89d3c36072)
4. Select the launch template bhumitatest and choose Actions, Modify template (Create new version)
5. Expand the Advanced Details section
6. Under Metadata accessible, select Enabled
7. Under Metadata version, select V2 only (token required)
8. Click on the Create template version button
9. Set the new version as the default by clicking on Actions, Set default version
10. Make sure the 1 launch configuration are using the latest version
11. Make sure the 1 EC2 instance are using the latest version
12. Wait until all instances are relaunched with the updated metadata version

4. Click Save rules to confirm

Findings.Title: Public machine image
Findings.Description: Image armorcode-golden-ami-1675829577 is publicly accessible via image permissions

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the EC2 console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/home?region=us-west-2#EditImagePermissions:imageId=ami-0c6e6c22f1804369d)
2. Before changing the permissions, verify that identities can access the image without public access level
3. Change the access to Private and optionally add explicit AWS account numbers to share the image with
4. Click on Save changes to confirm

Findings.Title: Unencrypted CloudTrail Logs
Findings.Description: Trail CT-AvidSecure is not configured with encryption

Console.Steps:
1. Sign in to the CloudTrail console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/home?region=us-west-1#/trails/arn:aws:cloudtrail:us-west-1:034025401910:trail/CT-AvidSecure)
2. In the General details section, click Edit
3. Set the Log file SSE-KMS encryption option to Enabled
4. Create a New KMS key or choose an Existing key
5. Click Save changes
